thread.title: Part Time Working Mummy blogger Rachaele Hambleton warns of Snapchat X game - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Part Time Working Mummy blogger Rachaele Hambleton warns of Snapchat X game - Yahoo7

author: News On March
title: Part Time Working Mummy blogger Rachaele Hambleton warns of Snapchat X game - Yahoo7
text:
Share Part Time Working Mummy blogger Rachaele Hambleton warns of Snapchat X game - Yahoo7 A UK mummy-blogger has issued a disturbing warning to parents about a “bullying game” circulating on social media among school children. Close Bullies Write Loser on 10-Year-Old Girls Forehead in Permanent Ink UP NEXT VIDEO Bullies Write Loser on 10-Year-Old Girls Forehead in Permanent Ink 
The writer, Rachaele Hambleton, said children would exchange Snapchat messages and compete to see who could say the cruelest thing about a given child. 
Publishing a letter to her daughter on her Part-Time Working Mummy Facebook account, Ms Hambleton paid tribute to her daughter for rejecting the craze. 
“It consists of sending someone the letter 'X',” she wrote. 
“That person then sends you back a name of someone you all know...you then write the most horrific things you can think of about that person - about their weight, their appearance, their personality... Teacher jailed after sending naked selfies to students 
“The more horrid the comments the better. It then gets posted anonymously, but publicly, upon snapchat stories for everyone to see & share.” 
She told UK tabloid The Mirror that bullying could have tragic consequences, appealing to children to reject such “games”. Rachaele Hambleton said she was proud of her daughter Betsy for refusing to play the bullying game. Photo: Facebook/Part-Time Working Mummy 
"There's so much peer pressure out there. Bullying is just endless now because of mobile phones,” she said. 
"Just stop it because people are taking their own lives because of this sort of thing - it's that serious."
